snippet: Allowing second baseman Robinson Cano to leave for Seattle rather than significantly increase their offer of $175 million for seven years was a victory for the Yankees.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball contends that New York Yankees made the right call in allowing All-Star second baseman Robinson Cano to leave for Seattle rather than increase their offer of $175 million for seven years; holds that team has learned not to repeat mistake they made when they gave aging Alex Rodriguez an exorbitant 10-year contract.
lead_paragraph: Allowing second baseman Robinson Cano to leave for Seattle rather than significantly increase their offer of $175 million for seven years was a victory for the Yankees.

headline.main: Yanks Try a New Tactic: Restraint
headline.print_headline: Yanks Try a New Tactic: Restraint
